N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4240.9 - Loan guarantees

State Regulations

The corporation may provide government contractor loan
guarantees, business development loan guarantees and franchise loan guarantees
(individually and collectively, the "loan guaranty") to eligible banking
organizations proposing to make loans for projects as described in sections
4240.6 through
4240.8
of this Part to enterprises
that qualify for such loans under said sections (except that the $50,000
minimum set forth in section
4240.8
[b]
of this

Part shall not apply to any loan secured by a business development loan
guaranty), subject to sections 4240.4 and
4240.10
of this Part and the
following: (a) the loan guaranty shall
be fully funded by the corporation; (b) the loans to be guaranteed must be
secured by an interest in collateral acceptable to the corporation; (c) the amount of the loan guaranty shall not
exceed 80 percent of eligible project costs as determined by the corporation in
consultation with the eligible banking organization proposing to make the loan
that shall be guaranteed; and
(d) loan guarantees shall not be available to enterprises receiving program
assistance in the form of a direct loan from the
corporation. Notes
